alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Isle of Wight; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Greensville, southeastern Charles City, west central Isle of Wight, central Southampton, northeastern Prince George, Sussex, southwestern James City, and Surry Counties, the City of Emporia and the City of Williamsburg through 145 PM EDT... At 1258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burrowsville to Homeville to near Jarratt. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Homeville and Burrowsville around 105 PM EDT. Waverly around 110 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 115 PM EDT. Rustic around 120 PM EDT. Claremont around 125 PM EDT. Wakefield around 130 PM EDT. Surry, Ivor, Scotland, Jamestown and Kings Point around 145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Pons, Grizzard, Booker, Yale, Pleasant Shade, Lumberton, Hilda, Dory and Gwaltney Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Greensville; Isle of Wight; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex
